name: heccibiggs
text:
I literally went GAAAAAAAH as I scrolled down to this.

What I want to know is, who saw this thing and went, "Y'know what, I'm going to try eating that badboy."

text: I've often wondered the exact same thing about lobsters and crabs.

name: foea
text: Monkfish are often called poor man's lobster. Maybe someone figured out that the uglier seafood is, the better it tastes. Hence, raw oysters.

name: random_shorts
text: Someone Japanese, I bet. I had Monkfish Liver at a sushi restaraunt. That, and a quail egg on top of salmon eggs. The more other species' potential offspring you can fit into one dish, the better, apparently.

name: goosey
text: Maybe that's not actually a monkfish, hence Tina's use of quotation marks.

name: afterward
text: If the fish, whatever it is, calls himself "Monkfish," that would explain both the quotation marks and the capitalization. But right now he's dead.

name: deancain29
text: Ray? why?

name: patkun
text: There is no better way to spend a night alone.

name: gouldgonewild
text: Hahaha, I love that since it is a picture from the past, Ray has all that hair...even though it's only 2000.

name: zedpower
text: Telling a girl she has a second birthday as far as you're concerned actually sounds like a good idea if you can follow up on it. I may try someday.

name: cactuscat
text: As long as presents are included, I think you're onto a winner.

name: rumblefish
text: This works less well if it's done to atone for missing her actual birthday. I'm pretty lucky to be married right now really.

name: letterswewrote
text: has anyone else noticed that lyle often has suspenders on from behind but you can never see them in the front?
